docs.abstract: The design makes it easier for young people to use.
docs.snippet: The design makes it easier for young people to use.
docs.lead_paragraph: Over 3.6 million middle and high school students used e-cigarettes last year, up by 1.5 million over 2017. The use of Juul, the most popular brand in the country, appears to have led this alarming increase among middle and high school students. This should not be a surprise.

headline.main: Juul Says It Doesn’t Target Kids. But Its E-Cigarettes Pull Them In.

docs.abstract: The surprise announcement was the latest sign of crisis at a company under scrutiny over its vaping products that have been highly popular among teenagers.
docs.snippet: The surprise announcement was the latest sign of crisis at a company under scrutiny over its vaping products that have been highly popular among teenagers.
docs.lead_paragraph: The vaping powerhouse Juul Labs replaced its chief executive  with a veteran of Big Tobacco on Wednesday, deepening the company’s turmoil and raising doubts about the very future of the e-cigarette industry.

headline.main: Juul Replaces Its C.E.O. With a Tobacco Executive
headline.print_headline: Besieged Juul Grabs a Lifeline From Big Tobacco

byline.original: By Sheila Kaplan, Matt Richtel and Julie Creswell

docs.abstract: After an earlier write-down of $4.5 billion, the tobacco giant’s stake in the vaping start-up is now worth one-third of what it paid in 2018.
docs.snippet: After an earlier write-down of $4.5 billion, the tobacco giant’s stake in the vaping start-up is now worth one-third of what it paid in 2018.
docs.lead_paragraph: Altria reported a $4.1 billion write-down on its Juul Labs investment on Thursday, another sizable charge as the vaping crisis continues to roil the e-cigarette industry.

headline.main: Altria Takes a $4.1 Billion Hit on Juul Stake

docs.abstract: Hundreds of stores are stocked almost entirely with flavored nicotine products that will soon be illegal to sell in New Jersey.
docs.snippet: Hundreds of stores are stocked almost entirely with flavored nicotine products that will soon be illegal to sell in New Jersey.
docs.lead_paragraph: EAST HANOVER, N.J. — Adam Mitrani opened his first Darth Vapor e-cigarette shop six years ago after his carwash business collapsed.

headline.main: Vape Shops Face a Choice: Close or Rebrand?
headline.print_headline: Vaping Shops in New Jersey Face Existential Choice
